section.title: Phrasal verbs
section.sectiontitle: Phrasal verbs use a verb + preposition. The meaning of the verb in a phrasal verb is often different from the normal meaning. Phrasal verbs are very common in English. For example: look after and grow up.
section.sectiontitle2: Some other common phrasal verbs are, come across (find), bring up (raise and educate), look up to (respect), get on with (have a good relationship with) and pick up (learn without trying).
section.text3: I found a 10 pound note on the street.
section.text3a: I came across a 10 pound note on the street.
section.text4: I have learnt a lot of English from pop songs.
section.text4a: I have picked up a lot of English from pop songs.
